More Notes: The increase in air-pollution-related health damages due to increased building energy use in response to climate change results in an estimated economic cost of $32.5 billion.
Specific to PM2.5-related deaths attributed to adaptive behavior (extra air conditioning use), the economic cost is approximately $6 billion.
